actor_awards.notes: Received an Academy Honorary Award in 2009. Won a Golden Globe and SAG Award for Best Supporting Actress for 'The Mirror Has Two Faces'. Known for her distinctive husky voice and sultry looks.

filmography.title: To Have and Have Not
filmography.role_description: A seductive drifter in Martinique who falls for a fishing boat captain, delivering the famous line, 'You know how to whistle, don't you?'
filmography.plot: An American expatriate in Martinique is reluctant to get involved in the French Resistance until he falls for a young woman.

filmography.title: The Big Sleep
filmography.role_description: The mysterious and sharp-witted daughter of a wealthy general who becomes involved with private eye Philip Marlowe.
filmography.plot: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family to investigate a blackmail case, which leads to a trail of murders.

filmography.title: Key Largo
filmography.role_description: A war widow running a hotel in the Florida Keys which is taken over by a mobster during a hurricane.
filmography.plot: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Claire Trevor)

filmography.title: Dark Passage
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic artist who shelters a man wrongly convicted of murder after he escapes from prison.
filmography.plot: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a young woman to prove his innocence.

filmography.title: How to Marry a Millionaire
filmography.role_description: The resourceful leader of three models who rent a penthouse in an attempt to snag wealthy husbands.
filmography.plot: Three women set out to find eligible millionaires to marry, but find true love in the process.

filmography.title: The Mirror Has Two Faces
filmography.role_description: The vain and critical mother of the protagonist who struggles with her own aging beauty.
filmography.plot: A professor who enters a platonic marriage to avoid sex falls in love with her husband, but complications arise when she undergoes a makeover.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: The Shootist
filmography.role_description: A widow who runs a boarding house and befriends a dying legendary gunfighter.
filmography.plot: A dying gunfighter spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum of pain and a maximum of dignity.

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: A loud and talkative American widow who is one of the suspects on the famous train.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.

filmography.title: Written on the Wind
filmography.role_description: A level-headed woman who marries into a wealthy, dysfunctional oil family.
filmography.plot: The alcoholic son of a Texas oil tycoon and his best friend fall for the same woman.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Dorothy Malone)

filmography.title: Designing Woman
filmography.role_description: A fashion designer who marries a sportswriter, leading to a clash of their very different worlds.
filmography.plot: A sportswriter and a fashion designer marry after a brief romance, but their lifestyles clash when they return to New York.

filmography.title: Young Man with a Horn
filmography.role_description: A wealthy but troubled socialite whose complex psychology distracts a dedicated jazz musician.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of a talented trumpet player who is torn between his music and a destructive relationship.

filmography.title: Harper
filmography.role_description: The cynical, disabled wife of a missing millionaire who hires a private investigator.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper is hired by a wealthy woman to investigate the disappearance of her husband.

filmography.title: Misery
filmography.role_description: The literary agent of a famous author who becomes concerned when he goes missing.
filmography.plot: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.

filmography.title: Dogville
filmography.role_description: A shopkeeper in a small, isolated town who eventually turns against the woman seeking refuge there.
filmography.plot: A woman on the run from the mob is reluctantly accepted in a small Colorado town, but the price of her safety turns into enslavement.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Bright Leaf
filmography.role_description: A madam who supports a tobacco tycoon in his rise to power and his rivalry with an old family.
filmography.plot: A ruthless tobacco tycoon builds an empire to destroy the family that ruined him, but alienates the woman who loves him.

filmography.title: Blood Alley
filmography.role_description: A doctor's daughter who helps an American sea captain ferry Chinese refugees to safety.
filmography.plot: A merchant marine captain rescues a village of Chinese from the Communists and transports them to Hong Kong.

filmography.title: The Cobweb
filmography.role_description: A staff member at a psychiatric clinic who becomes involved in the personal and professional conflicts of the institution.
filmography.plot: At a psychiatric clinic, the staff and patients are drawn into a conflict over new drapes for the library, masking deeper personal and professional tensions.

filmography.title: Woman's World
filmography.role_description: One of three wives whose behavior is scrutinized as their husbands compete for a top executive position.
filmography.plot: The owner of a major automobile company brings three managers and their wives to New York to choose a new general manager.

filmography.title: Sex and the Single Girl
filmography.role_description: A feuding wife involved in a comedic battle of the sexes.
filmography.plot: A tabloid reporter tries to expose a famous psychologist by impersonating her neighbor.

filmography.title: The Fan
filmography.role_description: A famous stage and screen star who is stalked by a deranged fan.
filmography.plot: A deranged fan begins stalking his favorite actress, and his obsession turns violent when she rejects his letters.

filmography.title: Birth
filmography.role_description: The mother of a widow who is confronted by a young boy claiming to be the reincarnation of her late husband.
filmography.plot: A young boy attempts to convince a woman that he is her dead husband reborn.

filmography.title: Manderlay
filmography.role_description: The owner of a plantation where slavery continues 70 years after the Civil War.
filmography.plot: A woman discovers a plantation where slavery is still practiced and attempts to impose democracy on the inhabitants.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Appointment with Death
filmography.role_description: A dominating Member of Parliament involved in a murder mystery in the Middle East.
filmography.plot: Hercule Poirot investigates the murder of the sadistic matriarch of a wealthy family during a vacation in the Holy Land.

filmography.title: Howl's Moving Castle
filmography.role_description: The voice of the jealous witch who curses Sophie in the English dub of Miyazaki's animated classic.
filmography.plot: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

filmography.title: The Walker
filmography.role_description: A Washington society dame who is part of the circle of a popular escort.
filmography.plot: An escort who caters to Washington D.C.'s society ladies becomes involved in a murder investigation.

filmography.title: My Fellow Americans
filmography.role_description: The wife of a former U.S. President in this political comedy.
filmography.plot: Two former U.S. Presidents, hated rivals, join forces to expose the current President's corruption.

filmography.title: Confidential Agent
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a coal magnate who aids a Spanish agent during the Spanish Civil War.
filmography.plot: During the Spanish Civil War, a musician becomes a secret agent and travels to England to secure a coal contract, where he meets a wealthy woman.
